output_list.criticism: The function mint() is vulnerable to integer overflow. The variable _newExp is calculated as _heroInstance.currentExp + _exp, which can lead to an overflow if _exp is large enough. This can be exploited by an attacker to cause the contract to revert and prevent the minting of new tokens.

The function addExp() is vulnerable to integer overflow. The variable _newExp is calculated as _heroInstance.currentExp + _exp, which can lead to an overflow if _exp is large enough. This can be exploited by an attacker to cause the contract to revert and prevent the addition of new experience points.

The function levelUp() is vulnerable to integer overflow. The variable _newExp is calculated as _heroInstance.currentExp + requiredExp, which can lead to an overflow if requiredExp is large enough. This can be exploited by an attacker to cause the contract to revert and prevent the leveling up of the hero.
